items.title: Get Started
items.text:
Tucker Island is a Discord server in support of Matt, Mikayla, and Tucker. The server is acceptance-based and all members are friends & family. The server is home to a variety of fun features that have been fine-tuned to appeal to everyone. This page contains documentation on every feature and will be updated according to feedback, updates, and new features.

Vefora Economy Court

Redirect

For more information you can visit the tab designated for ourVefora bot.

Vefora is a bot created by @xyb specifically for logging information that takes place in the server. It has documentation on all statistics relating to users, moderative actions, and can be especially helpful in court.

Redirect

For more information you can visit the tab designated for ourEconomy system.

The economy system is built on UnbelievaBoat, a Discord bot marketed specifically for its economy commands and overall system. It's simple in function, and has numerous gambling games you can play to earn yourself more money.

Redirect

For more information you can visit the tab designated for ourCourt system.

Court is a dynamic and fun activity that engages members of Tucker Island. It involves a judge, jury, prosecutor(s), defendant, and lawyer(s). The activity can generally span out to length a few hours, and involes both Criminal and Civil trials according to the server's list of Criminal Charges, and Suable Offenses.

Posted

All information is up to date as of 2026-02-23(ISO 8601)

items.title: Economy
items.text:
The economy system is managed by the Discord bot UnbelievaBoat. The economy influences events that happen in the server, roles, and more. If you'd like to go through the commands yourself please refer to:

Notice

Please only use economy-related commands in the designated channels, #economy, and #cell-block.

  • typing / in #economy, pressing the UnbelievaBoat icon and scrolling through.

  • visiting the official command page they provide. The server uses the default prefix, ! for all commands.

items.title: Getting Started
items.text: The economy system is simple, this cohesive guide will help you get started earning!

items.title: Earning Money
items.text: Earning money is an essential part of the experience on Tucker Island. It's good to know the basics!

items.title: work
items.text:
You pick up a job in the T-Regime and earn yourself ᛟ17-23. This command is usable every two minutes. 

/work

items.title: crime
items.text:
You can commit a crime in the T-Regime and potentially earn ᛟ600-1250. It's worth mentioning that there is a 60% chance of failure and a fine of 20 - 40%. This command is usable every twenty-five minutes. 

/crime

items.title: rob
items.text:
Allows you to rob another member of the Discord server, taking all the Cash they have. This command does have a chance of a fine, but all parameters of it are unknown. 

/rob <user>

  • <user> - Mention a user to attempt robbing them.

items.title: collect-income
items.text:
You have a government mandated ᛟ100 that you earn every day. This command allows you to recieve that money. For anyone that has a government-related role, you will recieve an additional amount of money on top of the regularly mandated payout. This amount is determined based on the following formula, (<people in server>*100)*0.05. 

/collect-income

items.title: Storing Money
items.text: When your money is stored it ensures other members of the server cannot rob you of your cash.

items.title: deposit
items.text:
Allows you to deposit all or a specific amount of cash into your bank. 

/deposit <amount | all>

  • <amount | all> - You can type a specific amount to deposit, or type all to deposit all the money you have into your bank. Optionally you can just leave it blank and use purely /deposit to deposit all, this method doesn't work with the ! prefix.

items.title: withdraw
items.text:
Allows you to withdraw all or a specific amount of cash into your bank. 

/withdraw <amount / all>

  • <amount | all> - Refer to deposit's explanation as it functions the same.

items.title: Spending Money
items.text: The ability to spend money is an important part of the server as you can buy collectables, and usable items of varying tradability. Some items will be exclusive or limited edition raising their value and encouraging in-server trading (selling). Usable items generally earn you benefits inside specific events, give your roles, or allow for other features.

items.title: store
items.text:
Allows you to view all the items the T-Regime has in market. 

/store [page]

  • [page] - Intakes an integer number, that puts you at the specified store page.

items.title: inventory
items.text:
Allows you to access all the items in your inventory. 

/inventory <user> [page]

  • <user> - Mention and specify which user's inventory you'd like to see, if left blank it'll default to you.
  • [page] - Refer to store's explanation as it functions the same.

items.title: buy-item
items.text:
Allows you to buy an item from the store. 

/buy-item [quantity] <item name>

  • [quantity] - Intakes an integer number, that buys the specified amount.
  • <item name> - Intakes a string value, that buys the item specified.

items.title: sell-item
items.text:
Allows you to sell (trade) an item in your inventory to another member for monetary gain. 

/sell-item <member> [quantity] <item name>

  • <member> - Mention and specify which user you'd like to sell to.
  • [quantity] - Intakes an integer number, that sells the specified amount.

items.title: use-item
items.text:
Allows you to use an item in your inventory. 

/use-item [quantity] <item name>

  • [quantity] - Intakes an integer number, that uses the specified amount.
  • <item name> - Refer to buy-item's explanation as it functions the same.

items.title: Gambling
items.text: Let's go gambling! The following gambling-related commands are available for usage.

items.title: blackjack
items.text: • blackjack [bet]

items.title: higher-lower
items.text: • higher-lower [bet]

items.title: roulette
items.text: • roulette [bet] <space>

items.title: cock-fight
items.text: • cock-fight [bet]

items.title: russian-roulette
items.text: • russian-roulette [bet]

items.title: roll
items.text: • roll [max number or options to choose from]

items.title: slot-machine
items.text:
• slot-machine [bet]

Command Usage

Please note that some are only accessible with the ! prefix. If you're having difficulties with any command please refer to the command page or contact staff.

items.title: Vefora
items.text:
... is a bot made with Tucker Island in mind. It's an automated logging tool for moderators and users alike. Most logs are posted in #public-logs under VEFORA __LOGS. Created by @xyb it's a dependable tool that tracks a large amount of data related to the server.

Common Q&A

Q: Why can't I use some commands that Vefora has? A: Not all commands/information is accessible to the general public. If you'd like to request specific information that you cannot access as a regular user please contact @xyb to submit the data-request.

Q: Am I allowed to privately request data in court? A: No, if participating in court please refer to using a verbal request rather than a private one. This action when used in court counts as using a witness if you decide to pull @xyb up for a testimony in regards to accessing the data desired.

items.title: Documentation
items.text: Vefora has a variety of functions.

items.title: Tracked Data
items.text:
Note: This only includes publically available data, and not what moderators can see.

User Tracked Data Server Tracked Data Data Name Data Type User ID int Jails int Unjails int Jail Timestamp time House Arrests int Probations int Tax Audits int License Suspensions int Dunces int Ordered Nicknames int Clown Kidnappings int Data Name Data Type Bans int Kicks int Timeouts int Elapsed Timeout float Jails int Unjails int Elapsed Jail Time float House Arrests int Probations int Tax Audits int Total Tax Audit float License Suspensions int Dunces int Ordered Nicknames int Clown Kidnappings int

items.title: info
items.text:
/info <server | user> <@user>
  • <server | user> - Choose between viewing server information and user-specific information.
  • <@user> - Only accessible if user is chosen for the first argument. Specifies which user you want to inspect.

Vefora Disclaimer

This bot is still under development at the moment. Please refer to the manual logs that @xyb has provided.

Thank you!
